Description of incident: The March 11 theft of an external hard drive used for backing up the Clinic's electronic files may have exposed patient information.  The hard drive was stored in a locked, fire-protected building with very limited access.  Many of the files contained patient Social Security numbers in addition to names, dates of birth, addresses and other clinical information.  There was a delay in notification due to the fact that there were duplicate files and patient contact information had to be updated. The Clinic has begun to encrypt records and raised the physical security of the files since the incident.
